column1: #Text=# NUBes: A Corpus of Negation and Uncertainty in Spanish Clinical Texts
#Text=This repository contains the NUBes corpus and other related material.
#Text=**WARNING:** Please note that the repository contains [Git LFS](https://git-lfs.github.com/) files.
#Text=problem cloning these files, please [get in touch](#contact) and we will provide alternative ways to obtain the data
#Text=The NUBes corpus (from "Negation and Uncertainty annotations in Biomedical texts in Spanish") consists of sentences
#Text=obtained from anonymised health records and annotated with negation and uncertainty phenomena.
#Text=As far as we know, it is
#Text=currently the largest publicly available corpus for negation in Spanish and the first that also incorporates the
#Text=annotation of speculation cues, scopes, and events.
#Text=IULA+ is a new version of the IULA-SCRC corpus (accessible [here](http://eines.iula.upf.edu/brat/\\#/NegationOnCR_IULA)).
#Text=More specifically, it consists of the same texts but annotated with NUBes' guidelines.
#Text=* The annotation guidelines can be consulted [here](.
#Text=* NUBes and IULA+ are distributed in [BRAT standoff format](https://brat.nlplab.org/standoff.html).
#Text=* NUBes is divided into 10 samples of approximately 3K sentences each.
#Text=/NUBes/SAMPLE-001)) has been annotated following a process involving 2 annotators and
#Text=  a referee, while the rest have been annotated by one person only.
#Text=In this regard, the first sample can be said to be
#Text=* The sentences in each sample have been in turn grouped by the medical specialty and report sections to which they
#Text=  contains sentences of the specialty "traumatology" and the section "chief complaint".
#Text=You can consult the sizes of NUBes and IULA+ in the following table:
#Text=<small><sup>*</sup> These numbers do not match those in the paper's Table 1; the correct counts are shown here.
#Text=All sensitive information (e.g., people names, healthcare facilities, dates, and so on) in NUBes have been subsituted
#Text=Furthermore, the sentences have been shuffled in order to hinder de-anonymization efforts as
#Text=That is, subsequent sentences in the corpus provided most likely did not occur together in the
#Text=What is more, sentences that belong to the same health record are scattered across different
#Text=To know more about NUBes, read our article "NUBes: A Corpus of Negation and Uncertainty in Spanish Clinical Texts"
#Text=To know more about IULA-SCRC, read the article "Annotation of negation in the IULA Spanish Clinical Record
#Text=Corpus" by Montserrat Marimon, Jorge Vivaldi and Núria Bel [[pdf](https://www.aclweb.org/anthology/W17-1807.pdf)].

column1: #Text=Please see Section [Citation](#citation) to learn how to cite these works.
#Text=This directory contains material and scripts related to the experiments section in the paper "NUBes: A Corpus of
#Text=Negation and Uncertainty in Spanish Clinical Texts" (see above).
#Text=Here you will find the dataset splits —train, development and test— used in the experiments.
#Text=provided contain the full set of features described in the paper.
#Text=explained below, to obtain the files to conduct the ablation study.
#Text=**WARNING:** Please note that this dataset is stored with [Git LFS](https://git-lfs.github.com/).
#Text=problem cloning these files, please [get in touch](#contact) and we will provide alternative ways to obtain the data.
#Text=This script generates the files necessary to perform the ablation study described in the paper.
#Text=For each data split, it will generate 6 new files, each with a different group of features left out.
#Text=The last file does not contain any feature apart from the tokens themselves.
#Text=Optionally, you may indicate input and output paths, as well as the number of parallel processes to be launched:
#Text=  -h, --help           show this help message and exit
#Text=  -i I, --input I      path to directory containing the dataset (default: data)
#Text=  -o O, --output O     path to output directory (default: data)
#Text=  -p P, --processes P  number of parallel processes (default: cpu_count()//2)
#Text=The following command should work out of the box:
#Text=This is the NCRF++ configuration file we used for training the models described in the paper.
#Text=specifies the neural network's architecture and hyperparamters.
#Text=Read about how to install NCRF++ and how to train models
#Text=and use them for decoding at https://github.com/jiesutd/NCRFpp.
#Text=**NOTE**: you must change the I/O section in the file so that
#Text=1. it points to your dataset files (parameters `train_dir`, `dev_dir` and `test_dir`)
#Text=2. it writes the resulting models to the desired folder and with the desired name (parameter `model_dir`)
#Text=This is the script we used to obtain the results reported in the article.
#Text=The results reported in the paper correspond to the category classification scenario.
#Text=The usage of the script is as follows:
#Text=  pred                  path to predictions file (accepts multiple paths)
#Text=  -h, --help            show this help message and exit
#Text=  --true T              path to gold standard file (default: data/test.bio)
#Text=Once you have trained your own model(s) and decoded the test set, you may evaluate the results simply by doing:
#Text=you should obtain perfect results (because you will be evaluating the gold labels against themselves).
#Text=If you use NUBes, IULA+ or any of the provided material in your publications, please cite us appropriately:
#Text=  author      = {Salvador Lima Lopez and Naiara Perez and Montse Cuadros and German Rigau},
#Text=  title       = "{NUBes: A Corpus of Negation and Uncertainty in Spanish Clinical Texts}",
#Text=  booktitle   = {Proceedings of The 12th Language Resources and Evaluation Conference (LREC2020)},
#Text=If you use IULA+, please cite also the paper describing the original corpus, IULA-SCRC:
#Text=  author      = {Montserrat Marimon and Jorge Vivaldi and N{\\'u}ria Bel Rafecas},
#Text=  title       = "{Annotation of negation in the IULA Spanish Clinical Record Corpus}",
#Text=  booktitle   = {Proceedings of the Workshop Computational Semantics Beyond Events and Roles (SemBEaR)},
